expr.str:
Privacy Policy

Last Updated: March 15, 2016

Emotion Mining Company, Inc ("EMCI") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy sets forth EMCI's policies and procedures regarding the collection, use and disclosure of personal information EMCI receives from users of EMCI's web sites and services.

Collection of Your Personal Information

By using EMCI's mobile applications, websites and services, you voluntarily and willingly provide us with certain information, including personally identifiable information, which we collect in order to provide these applications, websites and services. Personally identifiable information ("Personally Identifiable Information") refers to information about you that can be used to contact or identify you, and information about your use of and activities on our web sites and applications. Our web sites and applications include sites hosted at emotionmining.com and emovera.com, and mobile applications developed by Emotion Mining CO INC. Personally identifiable information that we collect may include, but is not limited to, your name, phone number, billing information, email address and home and business postal addresses. Personally identifiable information does not include the information filled out in EMCI's surveys while responding to specific topics ("Survey Information") or the segmentation information about you such as gender, age, nationality, race, ethnicity, religion, age, and more ("Segmentation Information"). If you are unsure whether you would like to provide the above information to us and/or have your information used as permitted in this Privacy Policy and in our Terms of Use, you should not register for our services.

We collect information from you in the following ways:

  • Registration: When you register to become a user of our mobile applications or websites, you provide us with Personally Identifiable Information to create your account and create your profile. If you decide not to share other Survey and Segmentation Information, you may not receive the full benefit of being an EMCI user or have access to all of the features and functionality of our services.
  • Sharing: In order to use certain features of EMCI's applications (such as sharing information from or about our applications with others), you may need to submit the names and email addresses of persons to whom you desire to send such information. Please note that when you send such information to another user or a non-user, your email address will be linked to the email address to which such private and confidential information is sent.
  • App and Site Usage: When you visit our applications or web sites, our servers automatically record information sent by the application or your browser. This information may include, but is not limited to, your computer's Internet Protocol address, browser type, the web page you were visiting before you came to our site and information you search for on our site. We may also collect information about the fact that you use certain features and functionality of our applications and websites. Your responses to our surveys and research initiatives will be anonymously aggregated with the responses of others, and will remain private and confidential to you unless you specifically opt to share your responses within or without the community of Emotion Mining and Emovera users.
  • Cookies: Like most websites, we use "cookies" and web log files to collect information to track site usage and trends, to improve our service, and to deliver a customized experience. A cookie is a small data file that resides in the memory of your computer, mobile phone or other device and enables us to recognize you when you return to our site or log into our service. We may use "persistent cookies" to save your registration ID and login password for future logins to the site. We may also use "session ID cookies", which expire after a short period of time or when you close your browser. Session ID cookies are used to identify a particular visit and are used to enable certain features of the site or service, to better understand how you interact with the site and service, and to monitor aggregate usage and web traffic routing on the site. You can instruct your browser, by changing its options, to stop accepting cookies or to prompt you before accepting a cookie from the websites you visit. If you do not accept cookies, however, you may not be able to use all portions of our applications and web sites.
  • Log Files, IP Addresses and Information About Your Computer and Mobile Device: When you visit our site or use our mobile applications, the communications standards on the Internet result in our automatically receiving the IP address of your computer or mobile device, and your computer or mobile device operating system. Our websites also receive the type of web browser you are using, the name of your ISP or mobile carrier, the URL of the site from which you came from, and the site to which you are going when you leave our site or service.

Use of Your Information

Consent to Use of Your Information: By submitting information to EMCI, including Personally Identifiable Information, Survey Information and Segmentation Information, you are expressly and voluntarily accepting the terms and conditions of this Privacy Policy. You have the right to withdraw your consent to EMCI's collection and use of your information by changing your account settings or closing your account, but your withdrawal of consent will not be retroactive. We may use the information you provide (i) to provide our site and services to you and administer your use of our site and services, (ii) to communicate with you and fulfill requests you may make, (iii) to provide you with information and announcements with respect to our services, and (iv) to provide you with further information and offers from us or third parties that we believe you may find useful or interesting, including newsletters, marketing or promotional materials and other information on services and products offered by us or third parties.

EMCI Communications: EMCI may use your Personally Identifiable Information to communicate with you through email and text messages through general community notices posted on EMCI applications and web sites or posted to your EMCI account, and to provide you with customer support. If you decide at any time that you no longer wish to receive any such communications, please follow the "unsubscribe" instructions provided in any of the communications sent to you.

Improvements and Customization: We may also use the information provided by you or obtained through your use of our sites or services to improve our sites, services, features and content to better understand your needs and interests, and to customize your user experience.

Management and Administration: We use information we obtain by technical means (such as the automatic recording performed by our servers or through the use of cookies) for the above purposes as well as to monitor, measure and analyze use of our websites, mobile applications and services, to generate and derive useful data and information concerning the interests, characteristics and website use behavior of our users, and to verify that visitors to the site meet the criteria required to process their requests.

Sharing of Your Information

General: We do not sell, rent or otherwise provide your Personally Identifiable Information to third parties for marketing purposes. Further, we only share your Personally Identifiable Information with third parties to carry out your instructions or to provide the service, unless otherwise compelled by law or as necessary to enforce our Terms of Use or to protect the rights or property of EMCI or its users or the public. We may provide Survey Information and Segmentation Information to third parties who are typically our customers and partners.

Service Providers, Business Partners and Others: We may employ third party companies and individuals to facilitate our service, to provide the service on our behalf, to perform services (including but not limited to data storage, maintenance services, database management, web analytics, payment processing, and improvement of the site's features) or to assist us in analyzing how our site and service are used. These third parties have access to your Personal Information only for purposes of performing these tasks on our behalf and are bound by confidentiality agreements that limit the use of your Personally Identifiable Information. We may also provide aggregated anonymous data about the usage of the Service to third parties for purposes that we deem, in our sole discretion, to be appropriate.

Sharing Information with Third Parties: Content distributed through EMCI's sharing features and third party integrations may result in displaying some of your information outside of EMCI, via e-mail or in services such as Facebook and Twitter.

Compliance with Legal Process; Protection of EMCI, its Users and the Public: We may be required to disclose your Personally Identifiable Information, profile information and/or information with respect to your use of our websites, mobile applications and services, and your activities as a EMCI user if required by subpoena or other legal process or requirement or if EMCI reasonably believes that such disclosure is necessary (i) to investigate, prevent or take action with respect to suspected or actual illegal activities or to assist government enforcement agencies, (ii) to protect the safety of any person from death or serious bodily injury, (iii) prevent fraud or abuse of EMCI, EMCI's users or the public, (iv) to enforce the EMCI Terms of Use, (v) to investigate and defend ourselves against any third party claims or allegations or to protect the security or integrity of our site or service, (vi) to exercise or protect the rights and property of EMCI, its users and the public.

Search Services: We offer search services to help find information and learn more about other EMCI users and to find specific content. EMCI uses information from user profiles and review of contributions to inform and refine our search services.

Business Transfers: EMCI may sell, transfer or otherwise share your information to a third party in connection with a merger, acquisition, reorganization or sale of assets or in the event of bankruptcy of EMCI and you agree that any such third party will have the right to continue to use your Personally Identifiable Information and other information that you provide to us or which we obtain through your use of the service.

Important Information

Changes to this Privacy Policy: EMCI may update this Privacy Policy from time to time, to, among other things, reflect changes to our services and customer feedback. We will notify you of changes to this Privacy Policy by posting an updated version at http://www.emotionmining.com/privacy that will revise the "Last Updated" date above. We encourage you to periodically review this Privacy Policy to be informed with respect to how EMCI protects your personal information and of any changes to this Privacy Policy. Using our mobile applications, web sites and other services after a notice of changes has been sent to you or published on our site shall constitute consent to the changed terms and practices. Unless stated otherwise, our current Privacy Policy applies to all information that EMCI has about you and your account.

Security of Your Personal Information: Although EMCI uses industry standard security measures, the Internet is not a 100% secure environment and EMCI cannot, and does not, ensure or warrant the security of any information you transmit or store using our websites, mobile applications and other services. There is no guarantee that your information may not be accessed, disclosed, altered or destroyed by breach of any of EMCI's physical, technical or managerial safeguards and we are not responsible for third party circumvention of your privacy settings or EMCI's security measures. You are responsible for maintaining the secrecy of your unique password and account information and for controlling access to your EMCI account.

Policy with Respect to Children: Children under the age of 13 are not eligible to use our service and we ask that people under the age of 13 do not submit any personal information to us or use the service. EMCI is not directed to children under 13 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from children under 13. If a parent or guardian becomes aware that his or her child has provided us with Personally Identifiable Information without their consent, he or she should contact us at request.emci@outlook.com. If we become aware that a child under 13 has provided us with Personally Identifiable Information, we will delete such information from our files.

Your Obligations: As a user, you have certain obligations to other users, including (i) you must comply with the then current version of this Privacy Policy and the Terms of Use, (ii) you must not abuse our mobile applications, web sites and web services by using it to spam, abuse, harass, or otherwise violate the rights of other EMCI users, and (iii) you must keep your password and account information confidential. Any violation of these guidelines may result in the suspension, restriction or termination of your EMCI account in EMCI's sole discretion.

Safe Harbor: We comply with the EU Safe Harbor Privacy Framework as established by the US Department of Commerce. By becoming a user, you have given us your express and informed consent to transfer the data that you provide to us to the United States and to process it in the United States.

Links: When you click through our mobile applications or on links on our web sites, you may leave our application or site. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of other mobile applications and web sites, and we encourage you to read the privacy statements of such mobile applications and web sites.

Contacting Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please email us at request.emci@outlook.com.
